wiki.content:
Every You Every Me is a single by alternative rock band Placebo. Appearing on their second album, it reached number 11 in the UK Singles Chart. The lyrics were written by frontman Brian Molko and ac acoustics' Paul Campion.
 
 The single was featured on the Cruel Intentions soundtrack . There are two versions of the video, both filmed live at London's Brixton Academy; one includes clips from the movie Cruel Intentions, the other does not. There are two different mixes of the song. The single mix which is also on the album Once More with Feeling and the album version on Without You I'm Nothing.
 
 The song was also used in the "Sorry" skate video (from the company Flip Skateboards) during Mark Appleyard's video part. The song is also featured in the Playstation video game F1 2000.
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.

comments: Смотреть. Новинка Клипа Dan Balan - Lendo Calendo (ft.Tany Vander & Brasco) смотреть на http://music-arena.p.ht/
Sucker love I always find, someone to bruise and leave behind. ♥
After a few years of ignoring this song I'm now listening via headphones and I'm surprised there's so much going on musically
This is so about Doctor Who. Well, it fits perfectly by coincidence, at least.
I love almost every Placebo song in existence (minus some from Battle for the Sun), and this  is not my favorite of theirs. But THIS IS THE SONG and it will always be.
Totally forgotten about this band! They were the soundtrack to my teenage years, especially this one. Still a great song!
Always when I'm sitting on the toilet and listen to this song I know I'm cool.
